subject: RE: [junit] Planning Unit Tests
msgSnippet: ... My personal speculation is that it took me significantly more time (more that 10%) to develop with unit test while learning this technique. But, if your
messageBody:
> A group of developers were recently asked whether an additional 10%
> of design/code time was adequate to write unit tests. I'm interested
> in feedback regarding what others think is adequate.

My personal speculation is that it took me significantly more time
(more that 10%) to develop with unit test while learning this technique.
But, if your tests are good (and my tests were good ;) ), time spent
with debugging is reduced by 80% (maybe 90%).

Just my experience with some small projects.

Bernd
